original: (a) PAYMENT INSTRUCTIONS. NPC shall prepare and transmit to NCB, in a mutually acceptable format, instructions specifying the payments to be made from the NCB Account to the Merchants and to NPC pursuant to this Agreement (the "Payment Instructions"). Payment Instructions shall be delivered to NCB in accordance with the schedule and procedures established from time to time by the parties.
modified: (b) PAYMENT DIRECTIVES. NCB is responsible for preparing and transmitting, in a mutually acceptable format, directives specifying the payments to be made from the NCB Account to the Merchants and to NPC, as required by this Agreement (the "Payment Directives"). These directives shall be delivered to NPC according to the schedule and procedures established by the parties from time to time.

original: (c) DUE DILIGENCE BY NCB FOR NPC PRICING STANDARDS. Senior management officials of NPC have met with senior management officials of NCB and have discussed with the NCB officials the pricing procedures and standards used for Merchants as customers for Merchant Processing Services. NPC shall keep NCB's senior management advised of any material changes in its pricing procedures and standards and of any material exceptions to such procedures and standards which may from time to time be made with respect to particular Merchants. NPC shall not make any such changes or exceptions until its management committee has approved such changes or exceptions after carefully evaluating the relative advantages and disadvantages expected to result from such changes or exceptions. If NCB's senior management officials reasonably determine from time to time that any changes are needed in NPC's pricing procedures and standards or in the implementation thereof, then NCB shall so notify NPC in writing, and NPC and NCB shall mutually agree upon, and NPC shall implement appropriate changes.
ollama_generated: (c) RECOMMENDATION POWER OF NCB ON NPC PRICING POLICIES. Although the senior management officials of NPC have previously discussed pricing procedures and standards for Merchants with their counterparts at NCB, it is acknowledged that the ultimate decision-making authority lies with NCB in this matter. NCB shall be informed about any significant alterations to NPC's pricing policies and any notable exceptions made regarding specific Merchants, but NCB may suggest such changes or exceptions without prior approval from NPC's management committee. In such cases, NCB shall communicate its recommendations for modifications in writing, and it will be left to the discretion of NPC to decide whether to implement these suggested changes. If, at any point, NPC decides not to make the proposed changes, it will be required to provide a justification and explanation to NCB.

original: ARTICLE II - AUTHORITY OF JOINT OFFICERS ---------------------------------------- 2.1 JOINT OFFICERS. In order to enhance NPC's effectiveness as an agent of NCB, the parties agree and acknowledge that it is desirable for one or more officers of NPC to serve also as an officer of NCB (the "Joint Officers") so that such persons shall have clear authority to represent NCB on matters relating to Merchant Processing Services. Accordingly, the Board of Directors of NCB shall elect the NPC officers named in Schedule B as Contracting Officers of NCB only with respect to matters pertaining to Merchant Processing Services. From time to time during the term of this Agreement, the Board of Directors of NCB may elect other officers of NPC as officers of NCB in addition to or in lieu of the Joint Officers. The authority of each Joint Officer to act as an officer of NCB shall terminate immediately upon termination of this Agreement or the termination or suspension of employment of that person by NPC for whatever reason or the removal of that person by the Board of Directors of NCB as an officer of NCB.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE II - AUTHORITY OF JOINT OFFICERS

----------------------------------------
2.1 JOINT OFFICERS. For the purpose of bolstering the capacity of NPC to act effectively as a representative of NCB, the parties agree and acknowledge that it is advantageous for one or more officers of NCB to also serve in a role within NPC (the "Joint Officers") so that these individuals can fully represent NCB on matters concerning Merchant Processing Services. In accordance with this agreement, the Board of Directors of NPC shall have the discretion to select the NPC officers listed in Schedule B as Contracting Officers of NCB only for matters regarding Merchant Processing Services. At any point during the term of this Agreement, the Board of Directors of NCB may choose other NPC officers to serve as officers of NCB beyond or instead of the Joint Officers. The authority of each Joint Officer to act as an officer of NCB will persist unless there is a termination of this Agreement, the termination or suspension of their employment with NPC for any reason, or their removal by the Board of Directors of NCB from their position as an officer of NCB.

In this revised clause, the key change is that the authority of each Joint Officer to act as an officer of NCB will persist unless there is a termination of this Agreement, the termination or suspension of their employment with NPC for any reason, or their removal by the Board of Directors of NCB from their position as an officer of NCB. This means that the authority of each Joint Officer is no longer terminated immediately upon termination of their employment by NPC, but rather persists unless those conditions are met.

original: (a) the laws, rules and/or regulations or any official interpretations thereof applicable to NCB as a National Bank or the Visa or MasterCard rules and/or regulations or any official interpretations thereof applicable to NCB and the matters covered by this Agreement are modified such that (i) any modifications in the relationship or transactions contemplated hereby between NCB and NPC or in the provisions of this Agreement are needed to comply with any such laws, rules, regulations or official interpretations thereof, or (ii) some or all of the activities contemplated by this Agreement are prohibited, or (b) Visa or MasterCard requires, as a condition to performance of this Agreement, that NPC enter into an agreement with Visa or MasterCard that NPC considers unacceptable, then at NPC's request, NCB will cooperate in making any modifications to this Agreement and to the parties' relationship hereunder to the extent any such modifications will permit NPC to continue processing, settling and authorizing bankcard transactions (or continue performing some of such functions) in compliance with the laws, rules, regulations or any official interpretations thereof applicable to NCB as a National Bank and the Visa and MasterCard rules, regulations, and interpretations thereof and any contractual terms required by Visa or MasterCard and acceptable to NPC (any such modifications being referred to as "Compliance Modifications") provided that such Compliance Modifications are reasonable and are not unduly burdensome to NCB, and NPC reimburses NCB for any additional costs reasonably incurred by NCB in connection with such Compliance Modifications.
ollama_generated:
(a) In the event that laws, rules, regulations, or official interpretations pertaining to NCB as a National Bank, Visa, MasterCard, or matters within this Agreement undergo any changes such that: (i) adjustments in the relationship or transactions outlined herein between NCB and NPC, or amendments to the terms of this Agreement, become necessary to adhere to such alterations; or (ii) some or all of the activities detailed by this Agreement become restricted, then upon NPC's request, NCB will collaborate in modifying this Agreement and the parties' relationship accordingly, as long as these modifications allow NPC to continue processing, settling, and authorizing bankcard transactions (or perform a portion thereof) while remaining compliant with applicable laws, rules, regulations, official interpretations, Visa and MasterCard guidelines, and any contractual terms stipulated by Visa or MasterCard that NPC finds acceptable. Such modifications shall be referred to as "Compliance Modifications." However, these Compliance Modifications must be reasonable and should not impose an undue burden on NCB, with NPC covering any additional costs reasonably incurred by NCB due to such Compliance Modifications.

   (b) If Visa or MasterCard stipulates, as a precondition for the performance of this Agreement, that NPC must enter into an agreement with either entity that NPC finds objectionable, then at NPC's discretion, NCB will make every effort to negotiate alternative terms acceptable to both parties to ensure continued compliance with the aforementioned requirements.

original: ARTICLE VIII - CONFIDENTIALITY ------------------------------ 8.1 CONFIDENTIALITY. In performing this Agreement, each party will have access to confidential information of the other. Each party agrees to hold in confidence and to instruct its employees and agents to hold in confidence all information and materials, in whatever form, reasonably designated as confidential by the party requesting confidentiality. NPC agrees to comply with all laws and regulations relating to confidentiality of customer lists and other information which are applicable to NCB and its agents or to NPC. NCB agrees to comply with all contractual obligations of NPC actually known to NCB and all laws and regulations applicable to NCB or NPC relating to confidentiality of customer lists and other information.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE VIII - CONFIDENTIALITY ------------------------------
8.1 CONFIDENTIALITY. In the course of executing this Agreement, each party may obtain sensitive information belonging to the other. It is acknowledged that each party shall exercise discretion and maintain confidentiality regarding all such information and materials, in any format, not publicly disclosed and reasonably marked as confidential by the disclosing party.

NPC assumes responsibility for adhering to all laws and regulations concerning the protection of customer lists and other information that are applicable to NCB or its representatives, while NCB acknowledges its obligation to abide by all contractual obligations pertaining to NPC, known or unknown, as well as all relevant laws and regulations regarding confidentiality of customer lists and other sensitive information for both parties.

original: - Inquire against Terminated Merchant File - Obtain and Review Personal Credit Reports on Principal(s) (when applicable) - Obtain and Review Dun & Bradstreet Report (when applicable) - Review of Financial Statements, Tax Returns and all other pertinent data (when applicable) - Investigation of previous processing relationship 4.       REASONS FOR DECLINING A MERCHANT.
ollama_generated:
4.      GROUNDS FOR APPROVAL CONSIDERATION OF A MERCHANT.

- Request examination of Terminated Merchant File - Consider and Review Personal Credit Reports on Principal(s) (where appropriate) - Consider and Review Dun & Bradstreet Report (where appropriate) - Examination of Financial Statements, Tax Returns, and all other relevant data (where appropriate) - Investigation into potential benefits of a processing relationship

This revised clause shifts the focus from reasons for declining a merchant to grounds for considering approval of a merchant. It weakens the obligation by using "consider" instead of "obtain and review" in some instances, suggesting a more flexible and discretionary approach. However, it maintains professionalism and fluidity in its language choice and structure.
